# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

Use this section to tell people about which versions of your project are
currently being supported with security updates.

| Version | Supported          |
| ------- | ------------------ |
| 1.0.x   | :white_check_mark: |
| < 1.0   | :x:                |

## Reporting a Vulnerability

Please report (suspected) security vulnerabilities through [GitHub Security Advisories](https://github.com/Monstatek/M1/security/advisories/new). Do not open public issues for security vulnerabilities. You will receive a response within 48 hours. If the issue is confirmed, we will release a patch as soon as possible depending on complexity.

### Security Considerations for M1 Project

1. **Firmware Security**
   - Secure boot implementation
   - Firmware update authentication
   - Memory protection unit (MPU) configuration
   - Secure storage of sensitive data
   - M1-specific security features



2. **Hardware Security**
   - M1 device security features
   - Secure element integration
   - Tamper detection
   - Secure debug access
   - Hardware-based security measures

### Security Measures

- Regular security audits
- Dependency vulnerability scanning
- Secure coding practices
- Hardware security features implementation
- Regular firmware updates
- M1-specific security testing

### Known Vulnerabilities

None currently known. All reported vulnerabilities will be listed here once they are fixed.

### Security Updates

Security updates will be released as patches for supported versions. Major security updates may require a full version upgrade.

### Responsible Disclosure

We follow responsible disclosure practices. Please do not disclose security vulnerabilities publicly until they have been addressed by our team.
